intro: Cephalandra grandis, commonly known as the giant head plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Araceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, followed by bright red berries. Cephalandra grandis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
